--- title: "1 - IntroducciÃ³n" subtitle: "Introducciendo Tidymodels" format: revealjs: slide-number: true footer: include-before-body: header.html include-after-body: footer-annotations.html theme: [default, tidymodels.scss] width: 1280 height: 720 knitr: opts_chunk: echo: true collapse: true comment: "#>" --- ::: r-fit-text Â¡Bienvenidos! ::: ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"}
### Nombre de la red Wi-Fi `TODO-ADD-LATER`
::: ::: {.column width="50%"}
### ContraseÃ±a de la red Wi-Fi `TODO-ADD-LATER`
::: ::: ## Normas del taller - CÃ³digo de conducta: `TODO-ADD-LATER` ## Quien eres? - Sabe utilizar la "pipa" de magritr (`%>%`) o R (`|>`) - Conoce las funciones de dplyr, tidyr y ggplot2 - Entiende conceptos estadÃ­sticos bÃ¡sicos - **No** necesitarÃ¡ ser experto en modelaje o aprendizaje automÃ¡tico ## El equipo Tidymodels - Simon Couch - Hannah Frick - Emil Hvitfeldt - Max Kuhn . . . Agradecimientos especiales para: Davis Vaughan, Julia Silge, David Robinson, Julie Jung, Alison Hill y DesirÃ©e De Leon ## ðŸ‘€ {.annotation} ## Que planeamos hacer en este taller - Tu presupuesto de datos - Las partes de un modelo - Evaluar modelos - Afinar modelos ::: notes This workshop will well-prepare folks going on to the Advanced tidymodels workshop, which will cover feature engineering and much more on hyperparameter tuning. ::: ## {.center} ### Salude a sus vecinos ðŸ‘‹

## Â¿Que es aprendizaje automÃ¡tico? ![](https://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/machine_learning.png){fig-align="center"} ## Â¿Que es aprendizaje automÃ¡tico? ![](https://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/machine_learning.png){fig-align="center"} - Â¿Este es tu sistema para aprendizaje automÃ¡tico? - SÃ­, le tiramos los datos a este monton de algebra linear, y despuÃ©s tomamos las repuestas que salen - Â¿Y si las respuestas estÃ¡n equivocadas? - Lo empezamos a mezclar hasta que algo se ve como correcto ::: footer ::: ## Â¿Que es aprendizaje automÃ¡tico? ![](images/what_is_ml.jpg){fig-align="center"} ::: footer ::: ## Â¿Que es aprendizaje automÃ¡tico? ```{mermaid} %%| eval: true %%| fig-width: 12 flowchart TB au[Aprendizaje\nAutomÃ¡tico\nClÃ¡sico] sp[Supervisada] au--Datos numÃ©ricos o categÃ³ricos-->sp us[No supervisada] au--Datos no estÃ¡n clasificados-->us cl[ClasificaciÃ³n] sp--Predice categorÃ­a-->cl rs[RegresiÃ³n] sp--Predice numero-->rs ag[AgrupaciÃ³n] us--Divide por similitudes-->ag rd[ReducciÃ³n\n de dimensiones] us--Busca dependencias\nescondidas-->rd as[AsociaciÃ³n] us--Identifica secuencias-->as ``` ::: footer ::: ## Tu turno {transition="slide-in"} ![](images/parsnip-flagger.jpg){.absolute top="0" right="0" width="150" height="150"} . . . *Â¿Como se relacionan las estadÃ­sticas y el aprendizaje automÃ¡tico?* *Â¿Como se parecen? Â¿Cuales son sus diferencias?* ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
03:00
``` ::: ::: ::: notes the "two cultures" model first vs. data first inference vs. prediction ::: ## Â¿Que es Tidymodels? ![](hexes/tidymodels.png){.absolute top=-20 right=0 width="64" height="74.24"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidymodels) #> â”€â”€ Attaching packages â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ tidymodels 1.1.1 â”€â”€ #> âœ” broom 1.0.5 âœ” rsample 1.2.0 #> âœ” dials 1.2.1 âœ” tibble 3.2.1 #> âœ” dplyr 1.1.4 âœ” tidyr 1.3.1 #> âœ” infer 1.0.6 âœ” tune 1.1.2 #> âœ” modeldata 1.3.0 âœ” workflows 1.1.4 #> âœ” parsnip 1.2.0 âœ” workflowsets 1.0.1 #> âœ” purrr 1.0.2 âœ” yardstick 1.3.0 #> âœ” recipes 1.0.10 #> â”€â”€ Conflicts â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ tidymodels_conflicts() â”€â”€ #> âœ– purrr::discard() masks scales::discard() #> âœ– dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() #> âœ– dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() #> âœ– recipes::step() masks stats::step() #> â€¢ Use suppressPackageStartupMessages() to eliminate package startup messages ``` ::: ## {background-image="images/tm-org.png" background-size="contain"} ## Expectativas del taller - El "mapa" de hoy - Procesos bÃ¡sicos de los modelos predictivos - Ver la ingenieria de caraterÃ­sticas (feature engineering) y afinamiento como extenciones cÃ­clicas ## Expectativas del taller ```{mermaid} %%| eval: true %%| fig-width: 12 flowchart LR ad[Todos\nlos datos] style ad fill:#fff,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr[Entrenamiento] style tr fill:#FBE9BF,stroke:#666,color:#000 ts[Prueba] style ts fill:#E5E7FD,stroke:#666,color:#000 ad --> tr ad --> ts ``` ## Expectativas del taller ```{mermaid} %%| eval: true %%| fig-width: 12 flowchart LR ad[Todos\nlos datos] style ad fill:#fff,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr[Entrenamiento] style tr fill:#FBE9BF,stroke:#666,color:#000 ts[Prueba] style ts fill:#E5E7FD,stroke:#666,color:#000 ad --> tr ad --> ts dt[Arbol de\nDecisiÃ³n] style dt fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr --> dt ``` ## Expectativas del taller ```{mermaid} %%| eval: true %%| fig-width: 12 flowchart LR ad[Todos\nlos datos] style ad fill:#fff,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr[Entrenamiento] style tr fill:#FBE9BF,stroke:#666,color:#000 ts[Prueba] style ts fill:#E5E7FD,stroke:#666,color:#000 ad --> tr ad --> ts lg[RegresiÃ³n\nlogÃ­stica] style lg fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr --> lg dt[Arbol de\nDecisiÃ³n] style dt fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr --> dt rf[Bosque\nAleatorio] style rf fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr --> rf ``` ## Expectativas del taller ```{mermaid} %%| eval: true %%| fig-width: 12 flowchart LR ad[Todos\nlos datos] style ad fill:#fff,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr[Entrenamiento] style tr fill:#FBE9BF,stroke:#666,color:#000 ts[Prueba] style ts fill:#E5E7FD,stroke:#666,color:#000 ad --> tr ad --> ts rs[Remuestreo] style rs fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr --> rs lg[RegresiÃ³n\nlogÃ­stica] style lg fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 rs --> lg dt[Arbol de\nDecisiÃ³n] style dt fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 rs --> dt rf[Bosque\nAleatorio] style rf fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 rs --> rf ``` ## Expectativas del taller ```{mermaid} %%| eval: true %%| fig-width: 12 flowchart LR ad[Todos\nlos datos] style ad fill:#fff,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr[Entrenamiento] style tr fill:#FBE9BF,stroke:#666,color:#000 ts[Prueba] style ts fill:#E5E7FD,stroke:#666,color:#000 ad --> tr ad --> ts rs[Remuestreo] style rs fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr --> rs lg[RegresiÃ³n\nlogÃ­stica] style lg fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 rs --> lg dt[Arbol de\nDecisiÃ³n] style dt fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 rs --> dt rf[Bosque\nAleatorio] style rf fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 rs --> rf sm[Seleccionar\nmodelo] style sm fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 lg --> sm dt --> sm rf --> sm ``` ## Expectativas del taller ```{mermaid} %%| eval: true %%| fig-width: 12 flowchart LR ad[Todos\nlos datos] style ad fill:#fff,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr[Entrenamiento] style tr fill:#FBE9BF,stroke:#666,color:#000 ts[Prueba] style ts fill:#E5E7FD,stroke:#666,color:#000 ad --> tr ad --> ts rs[Remuestreo] style rs fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr --> rs lg[RegresiÃ³n\nlogÃ­stica] style lg fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 rs --> lg dt[Arbol de\nDecisiÃ³n] style dt fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 rs --> dt rf[Bosque\nAleatorio] style rf fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 rs --> rf sm[Seleccionar\nmodelo] style sm fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 lg --> sm dt --> sm rf --> sm fm[Entrenar modelo\nselecionado] style fm fill:#FBE9BF,stroke:#666,color:#000 sm --> fm tr --> fm ``` ## Expectativas del taller ```{mermaid} %%| eval: true %%| fig-width: 12 flowchart LR ad[Todos\nlos datos] style ad fill:#fff,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr[Entrenamiento] style tr fill:#FBE9BF,stroke:#666,color:#000 ts[Prueba] style ts fill:#E5E7FD,stroke:#666,color:#000 ad --> tr ad --> ts rs[Remuestreo] style rs fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 tr --> rs lg[RegresiÃ³n\nlogÃ­stica] style lg fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 rs --> lg dt[Arbol de\nDecisiÃ³n] style dt fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 rs --> dt rf[Bosque\nAleatorio] style rf fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 rs --> rf sm[Seleccionar\nmodelo] style sm fill:#FDF4E3,stroke:#666,color:#000 lg --> sm dt --> sm rf --> sm fm[Entrenar modelo\nselecionado] style fm fill:#FBE9BF,stroke:#666,color:#000 sm --> fm tr --> fm vm[Verificar la\ncalidad] style vm fill:#E5E7FD,stroke:#666,color:#000 fm --> vm ts --> vm ``` ## Instalemos unos paquetes ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} pkgs <- c("bonsai", "doParallel", "embed", "finetune", "lightgbm", "lme4", "plumber", "probably", "ranger", "rpart", "rpart.plot", "rules", "splines2", "stacks", "text2vec", "textrecipes", "tidymodels", "vetiver", "remotes") install.packages(pkgs) ``` ::: . . .

## Nuestras versiones ::: {.cell} ::: R version 4.3.2 (2023-10-31), Quarto (1.4.550) ::: {.columns style="font-size:0.7em;"} ::: {.column width="25%"} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} |package |version | |:----------|:-------| |bonsai |0.2.1 | |broom |1.0.5 | |dials |1.2.1 | |doParallel |1.0.17 | |dplyr |1.1.4 | |embed |1.1.3 | |finetune |1.1.0 | |ggplot2 |3.5.0 | |lightgbm |4.3.0 | ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="25%"} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} |package |version | |:---------|:--------| |lme4 |1.1-35.1 | |modeldata |1.3.0 | |parsnip |1.2.0 | |plumber |1.2.1 | |probably |1.0.3 | |purrr |1.0.2 | |ranger |0.16.0 | |recipes |1.0.10 | |remotes |2.4.2.1 | ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="25%"} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} |package |version | |:-----------|:-------| |rpart |4.1.23 | |rpart.plot |3.1.2 | |rsample |1.2.0 | |rules |1.0.2 | |scales |1.3.0 | |splines2 |0.5.1 | |stacks |1.0.3 | |text2vec |0.6.4 | |textrecipes |1.0.6 | ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="25%"} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} |package |version | |:------------|:-------| |tibble |3.2.1 | |tidymodels |1.1.1 | |tidyr |1.3.1 | |tune |1.1.2 | |vetiver |0.2.5 | |workflows |1.1.4 | |workflowsets |1.0.1 | |yardstick |1.3.0 | ::: ::: ::: :::

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
